Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." GMCs at Amravati, Buldhana get in-princi.description: NAGPUR: Crunch in MBBS seats will ease to some extent as the central government has given in-principle approval to seven new Government Medical Colleges in state. These include two in Vidarbha at Amravati and Buldhana. Medical education minister of Maharashtra Girish Mahajan told TOI Ministry of health and family welfare had given an in-principle approval to state government’s proposal to upgrade seven district hospitals in state into medical colleges. “I had a very fruitful meeting with Union health minister Dr Harsh Vardhan last week. He has sanctioned many proposals given by the state’s health education department. These include seven GMCs and several research institutes. This will bring in 3,670 more MBBS seats and nearly 800 PG seats in the state in the long run,” Mahajan said. The central government’s health ministry has a scheme to establish new medical colleges by upgrading district or referral hospitals. As part of this, it has been proposed to convert 75 district hospitals into medical colleges to boost availability of human resource for health sector. Maharashtra has proactively submitted proposals for seven district hospitals. When these hospitals become medical colleges, the directorate of medical education (DMER) will run them instead of directorate of health services (DHS). This is still a first step. It takes time to establish a medical college even if a general hospital has many basic facilities. According to a senior official of DMER, the state as well as the Centre were keen to increase MBBS and MD seats as it was necessary for the implementation of EWS reservation. “The in-principle approval is a major step. These seven new GMCs will be functional in next two years,” the official claimed. At present, there are 41 medical colleges in State. They are affiliated to Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS). In Vidarbha, there are two GMCs in Nagpur, and one each in Chandrapur, Yavatmal, Akola, and Gondia. Major boost to medical education New medical colleges: District hospitals in seven districts — Buldhana, Amravati, Satara, Parbhani, Nandurbar, Nashik and Sindhudurg will become medical colleges Long pending Institutes: Pending work of Regional Institute of Paramedical Science in Nagpur, Special paramedical centres in Pune and Miraj will be completed Research organization: Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) in Nagpur will have a centre of excellence in Sickle Cells Hemoglobinopathy developed by ICMR Cancer care: As projects like National Cancer Grid, Virtual Tumour Board, Cancer Fellowship are to be implemented in state, a national cancer institute will be started in Jalgaon More MBBS Seats: Total 3,670 seats will be added to state’s quota. From these, 2020 could be used for implementation of EWS reservation and 1650 for implementation Maratha reservation Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Varsity brings in new engg syllabus over.description: NAGPUR: Sitting over it for over one and half years, the Nagpur University (NU) has suddenly decided to implement the model All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) curriculum from this academic year after a mere two-hours discussion over lunch. Questions have been raised over NU’s move since none of the stakeholders was informed about it even as the new academic year is set to start in a couple of weeks. While concerns have been raised over damage a hurriedly prepared syllabus may leave on NU’s engineering education, this year’s aspirants would be at a loss of not knowing the entire four-year syllabus. Last week, the proposal was tabled before the Board of Studies (BoS) to clear the move when one of the members reflagged it and demanded an elaborate deliberation. So far, only the first-year syllabus has been formulated. Mahendra Chaudhary, who is a BoS Applied Science and Humanities as well as Senate member, was shocked to know about the proposal. He refused to sign the proposal until the BoS allowed discussion on the new syllabus. “I wrote to the vice chancellor expressing my concerns. We need to think about students from the region. The AICTE curriculum is meant for IIT-level students while our colleges have 45 percenters enrolled with them. Ideally, there should be been discussion spread over months. But, now at least faculty members need to be informed through some initiative,” Chaudhary said. On his demand, the NU has agreed to organize workshops, which too has been alleged as a futile exercise. “The discussion is on the proposed syllabus which means the already decided one would be implemented. Only a handful of engineering faculty members were invited to formulate this new syllabus which is not in accordance with AICTE norms,” some teachers told TOI. The discussions to be held at different colleges from Monday have been dubbed as eyewash since it would deliberate on the syllabus for just over two hours. As per the workshop schedule, the discussion would taken up after lunch between 2.30pm and 4.30pm. Those opposed to NU’s abrupt move wanted involvement of all stakeholders since the start. Stakeholders involve parents, students’ representatives, industry professionals, academicians apart from university officials and members. Surprisingly, the NU has kept the entire affair under wraps as it never bothered to invite suggestions and objections from stakeholders in the last one and half years. The AICTE had introduced the model curriculum in January 2018. The NU also never uploaded a single document or meeting notice on its website about the move. University’s Vice chancellor SP Kane didn’t respond to TOI’s calls and SMS. The new curriculum envisages more weightage to region specific and skill-based learning. Over 60 credits too have been cut to encourage industry internships. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\u2018Main Gadha Hoon\u2019 has the audi.description: Nagpur: ‘Main Gadha Hoon’, a stand-up comedy staged by Shreyas Manohar at Vishnuji Ki Rasoi on Saturday, was a mix of satire and mimicry and touched on many issues of people, including use of phone by teens and adults alike. Vishnu Manohar, Vijay Jathe and Milind Deshkar were the organizers of the show. The event commenced with Vishnu Manohar and Jathe entertaining the people by explaining the idea of a stand-up comedy and sharing their anecdotes here and there that made the atmosphere lighter. Shreyas Manohar, known for his humour and charm, was the main attraction as he talked about his time in New York, Goa and Mumbai. He gave many instances of his stay at different places. He spoke on topics like success and the blessings needed for it. He asked the people questions like if they thought their dreams had become a reality. “Do you really think you are successful? I mean it’s definitely arguable,” he asked jokingly. Shreyas took potshots at what he termed WhatsApp University Community being formed most of whose members are adults and kitty party members. “You adults blame us youngsters for being on the phone all the time. Well, it’s not true any more. Look how the tables have turned,” he said amid laughter. He got in conversation with someone in the crowd, one of them was Jathe. “I appreciate you cutting me off for the fourth time, sir. It’s not disturbing at all,” he said when Jathe asked him to speak louder. This was followed by a roar of laughter from the audience. Manohar talked about his life in Mumbai and how people there were really hardworking. “If you try to wake up at 7am, the neighbour is already up at 6am. If you wake up at 6am, the neighbour woke up at 4.30am to go for a jog. If you wake up the next day at 4.30am, you come to find out that the neighbour did not sleep at all the previous night. That is some high level hard work you have to do for that.” He also talked about his experience abroad and how and what Americans thought of India. “Once a girl asked me what was my favourite flavour of ice-cream to which I replied vanilla. She was so shocked when I told her that vanilla was sold in India.” (Reporting by Shristi Sankrit) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. \nJohn Abraham, Varun Dhawan and Jacquel.description: When a fan challenged Varun Dhawan to lift his 'Dishoom' co-star John Abraham, he sportingly did so at a college event in Nagpur. Later, at a media event in Nagpur, Varun Dhawan challenged Jacqueline Fernandez to lift John Abraham. The actress surprised everyone with her sincere attempt. But John proved to be the real ‘Hulk’ as he scooped Varun in his arms, while Jacqueline piggybacked. Talk about muscle power! Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Over 1000 delivery boys accuse Zomato of.description: NAGPUR: Over 1,000 delivery boys attached to food delivery portal Zomato have struck work accusing the food aggregator of exploiting them by imposing ‘unrealistic’ incentive policy which has severely impacted their monthly income. They say so far they had been earning around Rs25,000-30,000 per month by working 16 hours a day. According to them, the company has increased the daily targets to 18 orders (Mon to Thursday) and 22 on weekends which is impossible to achieve and ultimately result in loss of incentives. “Without incentives, there is no earning for us,” says a delivery boy from Zomato’s Dharampeth zone. These boys have gone offline since last three days demanding rollback of the new policy and employment safeguards. On Sunday, they gathered at Traffic Park where they planned a massive rally to be taken out at Samvidhan Square on Monday. The company has denied any knowledge of the ongoing protest supported by Shiv Sena’s city unit. Zomato city manager Vipul Sinha said he wasn’t aware of the issue before disconnecting TOI’s call. Those who chose to work delivered food in plain clothes rather than the trademark red T-shirts to avoid confrontation with the protesters. Shiv Sena city coordinator Nitin Tiwari said the youths are ready to work even 16 hours a day but for earlier pay package. “They work for per order commission plus weekly incentives. Since Zomato’s entry in Nagpur, they have been delivery food from 7am to 11pm. Some even worked till 4am to meet the demanding targets. All they want is continuation of the same policy,” Tiwari said. Tiwari said the new policy makes completion of 18 orders per day from Monday to Thursday and 22 on weekends a must for incentive payouts between Rs575 to 700. Though the payout is marginally increased, it is impossible to cater the orders within 24 hours, Tiwari said. “No incentive is paid if you fall short of even one order,” he added. Another delivery agent said each order takes about one to one-and-half hours to complete before they are available for the next order. “We would need 28 hours to meet the new target. This is impossible. We have been somehow managing 16 orders by working over 16 hours in last one and half years. The distance between restaurant and client has increased now. None of bikers are given orders within 3 kms range after cycle riders were hired,” he said. “This is exploitation of jobless youths. The company is threatening to file police complaints against those who are raising voice against this injustice,” Tiwari said. One of the delivery boy said in case they don’t qualify for incentives, their earning would reduce to just 7,000 a month. Tiwari said he would be meeting the commissioner of police, labour commissioner and district collector on Monday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nAshwamedh staged at Ram Nagar Ground i.description: The tale and triumph of five rulers — Chandragupta Maurya, Harshvardhana, Prithviraj Chauhan, Krishnadevaraya and Swargnarayana — was beautifully narrated through Hindi mega play Ashwamedh, which was recently staged at Ram Nagar Ground. Nagpur’s theatre aficionados were enchanted with superlative performances of the artistes and the gripping story kept the audiences on the edge of their seats. What added grandeur to this two-hour show were colourful dance sequences and the magnificent set designs. Director of the play Dr Vinod Indurkar said, “The concept and technique of mahanatya is different than normal plays. You have a narrator, elaborate backdrops and recorded dialogues, which make for an entertaining theatrical treat for the viewers. It is overwhelming to see audience being so receptive and a good turnout is a great motivation for a creative person.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gangster Vijay Mohod murdered over gambl.description: NAGPUR: The speculation around gangster Vijay Mohod, 32, ended around 7.30 am on Monday when his body was found with numerous stab wounds at Vela Hari village in the outskirts of the city. The murder, over rivalry on gambling dens which are now controlled by top goons in the city as cops are turning a blind eye on them, likely had taken place a day ago. Mohod, having two murder charges against him, is learnt to have suffered 39 stab wounds on his body. His murder may now trigger a gang war between his close aides and ‘Beats group’ whose members, including Abhay Raut, is suspected to be involved. The case has been transffered to crime branch. Mohod was kidnapped a day ago from a Saoji eatery allegedly by Raut and his aides in a car. Around 20-25 people had come to abduct Mohod in three to four cars. It is learnt both Mohod and Raut wanted to maximize profits from the gambling dens they were operating. Raut is learnt to be operating one at Kharsoli while Mohod’s was at Dhamna. Sources said Raut wanted Mohod to amalgamate their illegal businesses and share more profits which Mohod was resisting. Raut possibly lured Mohod with an offer to see a new place at Kharsoli where they could start a new den. Mohod was with his friends Rupesh Bonde and others at the eatery near Outer Ring Road from where he was taken in a car. Later, his family members and friends got a call from a close aide of Mohod that he had been murdered. Police searched for him on Sunday but found nothing. A case of kidnapping was registered at Hudkeshwar police station in the wee hours of Monday. “We received a response from cyber team that both of Mohod’s cellphones were showing presence near Vela Hari village. Shortly afterwards, we found his body on the roadside,” said PI Sandeep Bhosale of Hudkeshwar police station. Raut, close to arrested gangster-turned-bookie Swapnil Salunkhe, is learnt to have inflicted 44 stab wounds on his last victim Palash Diwte in October last year. Though several other names had cropped up, Hudkeshwar police insisted Raut alone was responsible for the murder. Raut got bail in this case too. After his release, he began asserting his influence. Another theory is that Mohod had threatened one Dilip for having beaten Sarang Thaokar over certain monetary dues. A relative of Mohod said Sarang owed around Rs 1.5 lakh to Salunkhe that he had lost in cricket betting. Dilip, close to Salunkhe, was threatening Sarang when Mohod intervened. Mohod had taken Sarang to Salunkhe asking him not to bother him for dues any more. Despite Mohod’s intervention, Dilip had thrashed Sarang which was not taken lightly by Mohod. Top goons like Diwakar Kottulwar and his aides are also operating a major gambling den at Fetri under Hingna police station. Following a dispute at his den, Mohod had kidnapped gangster Maroti Nuwah around two months ago at gunpoint. Diwakar too had ensured no other gambling dens came up in his vicinity. Mystery over Salunkhe’s arrest four days ago Nagpur: Swapnil Salunkhe was arrested by Pachpaoli police on June 13 for an offence of assault on cops registered in 2017. He was earlier rounded up by crime branch in January 2017 but was let off after a senior officer intervened. His arrest in the same case one and half years later Salunkhe when there are 11 accused named is baffling. Two more brothers of dreaded gangster Ippa, Naushad and Irshad too are at large in the case. Salunkhe was not on good terms with Vijay Mohod who was murdered on Sunday. The prime suspect in the murder, Abhay Raut, is learnt to be close to Salunkhe. PWD transforms 80 govt structures into g.description: Nagpur: Setting an example for private properties, the state’s Public Works Department (PWD) has converted 80 government buildings into ‘green buildings’, and also obtained ratings from the Green Rating for Integrated Habitat Assessment (GRIHA) Council in Vidarbha. One new building has also been constructed as per green building norms, and there are plans for 136 new green buildings in the region. PWD chief engineer Ulhas Debadwar told TOI the plan is to convert 1,500 existing government buildings into green buildings in entire state by 2021. “Some 300 buildings were selected in phase-I, of which works on 201 has been completed. Works on remaining buildings are likely to be completed soon. Target is to cover 525 more buildings in phase-II across the state. MoU for phase-II was executed with GRIHA Council in the city recently,” he said. Under PWD-GRIHA green building Initiative, MoU was executed between the two agencies for transforming 300 existing government buildings, including 121 from Vidarbha, into green buildings in January. The team from GRIHA inspected the buildings and suggested the works. Registration of buildings was done in February. PWD completed works on 201, including 80 in Vidarbha, in three months. GRIHA teams conducted inspection and gave ratings this month. PWD superintending engineer Vidyadhar Sardeshmukh told TOI PWD has also started construction of all new government buildings as per green building norms. “Target is to construct 201 new buildings, including 137 in Vidarbha, as per green building norms. Works on two buildings, of which one in Nagpur division at Chandrapur and other in Pune division, has been completed. We constructed Van Bhavan at Chandrapur under the project and got five-star rating,” he said. Sardeshmukh added the building of Maharashtra National Law University (MNLU) being constructed by PWD near Waranga will be a complete green building. “We are constructing buildings at GMCH, Mayo Hospital and other locations too with the same concept,” he said. Sardeshmukh said PWD transformed some historic existing buildings like Vidhan Bhavan, Rajbhavan, Ravibhavan, Hyderabad House etc in the city into green buildings under the project. “Main objective is to reduce power and water consumption, ensure safe disposal of sewage and garbage, reduce carbon emissions, conserve environment, and increase life of the structures. We are replacing all lights with LED and laying reflective paint on terrace to reduce power consumption inside the buildings,” he said. Sardeshmukh also said they plan to operate buildings on solar power after getting rating in phase-I. “Already, tenders for installation of solar power systems on 390 buildings have been floated in the state, of which 40 are in Nagpur division. Solar power systems will be installed in rest houses first like Ravibhavan, MLA Hostel etc in the city,” he said. Sardeshmukh said PWD will save around 2,200MW per annum used in government buildings after completion of phase-I works. GRIHA Council, a not-for-profit society jointly established by the ministry of new and renewable energy, and The Energy and Resources Institute (TERI) has claimed phase-I works resulted in annual reduction of 2,721 tonne of carbon emissions, which is equivalent to eliminating 600 vehicles from the roads in the state. NMC’s special purpose vehicle for Smart City project — Nagpur Smart and Sustainable City Development Corporation Limited — in association with Indian green building Council (IGBC) has planned to develop the city into the country’s Model Green City. The plan is to encourage and help in construction of all new buildings as per the norms of green buildings. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Jaripatka residents gherao mayor over \u.description: NAGPUR: Residents of Snehdeep Nagar and peripheries of Hadasram Dharmshala, Indira Colony, Janata Hospital and many other localities under Prabhag number 1 (Jaripatka) are not getting regular tap water. To bring this issue to the notice of the authorities, a residents led by former NCP corporator Vedprakash Arya and Congress workers on Monday gheroed mayor Nanda Jichkar in her office. Women residents demanded scrapping privatization of water supply system while alleging irregularities in tanker service. Even after booking tankers on time, water is supplied after a gap of four to five days, they claimed. Arya pointed out that in the last eight years water supply of Nagpur city has increased from 500 MLD to 740 MLD. “Still non-revenue water has not come down,” he claimed. Mayor Jichkar directed the water supply department to look into the matter. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Data on crime against Dalits too good to.description: NAGPUR: Chairman of National Scheduled Castes (SC) Commission Shanker Katheria said the figures reported to him by local police, that only 43 crimes have taken place against Dalits in the city, with no case of murder or rape registered during last one year, are too good to believed. Katheria, who is on a tour gathering data throughout the state before a review meeting in August, said it seems there is a need to relook into the figures. Out of the 43, four cases have been registered under Atrocities Act, he said. Charge sheets have been filed in all except four cases, he said. However, he also admitted that if true indeed, then the condition of SCs is much better in Maharashtra. as compared to states like Haryana, Rajasthan or Uttar Pradesh where it is a matter of concern indeed. “If it’s 43 cases in Nagpur, then in a similar area in a state like Haryana, Uttar Pradesh or Rajasthan it would be easily up to 200,” said Katheria while talking to newspersons here. Katheria expressed concern over the overall condition of SCs in the country. He said, “Even as not much cannot be commented without exact data in hand, the overall condition is not very satisfying. There are many pockets in which the quotas for jobs or education have not been filled up entirely.” “Last week, a Dalit family was a victim of a political mob violence in West Bengal. Six members of a family including a 16-year old girl are missing and three people have been killed. We have raised concern against political violence against the community,” he said. Katheria was told by scribes at the meeting about the murder of 54-year-old Usha Kamble and her one-and-a-half-year-old granddaughter, that took place last year at Pawamsut Nagar, near Dighori Naka. “This means that it was not true that no murder of a Dalit took place during last one year,” said the scribes. He assured to look into the matter. “The local authorities were not in a position to furnish information about the status related to education and benefits of reservation availed by the community in Nagpur. At the same time, I was told that the government schools were in a poor condition with many not even having toilets for girl students,” he said. The commission will also clear 100 serious cases from Maharashtra, which are related to Atrocities Act or alleged injustices in services in month’s time. There are 40,000 cases from the entire country pending with the commission, he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two murders, one murderous assault rock.description: NAGPUR: Two murders, and a murderous assault on a gangster, within 24 hours left the city cops in a tizzy on Sunday. Ganesh Tandulkar, an autorickshaw stand coordinator at Jhansi Rani Chowk, was allegedly hacked to death by a gang of fellow drivers on Saturday. The assailants were apparently enraged that he shielded a man they wanted to eliminate. The incident took place at Udibaba Chowk in MIDC. The MIDC police acted quickly in the Tandulkar murder case, arresting three assailants, Abhijeet Singh, Rakesh Kuryavanshi and Vicky Dabekar. Within hours, 22-year-old Gaurav Nagpure was stabbed to death by his rivals near a community toilet at Gangabai Ghat within the jurisdiction of Kotwali police station. Nagpure was attacked by his neighbours-turned-foe Tejas Bagde, Shoaeb Malik, Bobby Malik and others with sharp weapons over old rivalry. The injured Nagpure was rushed to hospital, where he was declared dead. Later in the evening, city and rural police set off on another chase when news of a murderous assault on gangster Viju Mohod started doing the rounds. Sources in the police said Mohod, who had kidnapped gangster Maroti Nuwa around two months ago, was apparently kidnapped from an eatery by close aides of another gangster, and thrashed up very badly. Staffers from Beltarodi, Nandanvan, and Sakkardara police stations of city, and Kuhi in rural, started a frenetic search to track down more information. Mohod had a dispute with another goon, identified as Amit Bilge, some days back, which was settled at marriage of one Bobby. Despite this, Mohod had been attacked by his rivals, and was in critical condition at hospital when reports last came in. The mastermind of the gang that attacked Mohod had been arrested by Pachpaoli police in an offence registered in 2017. In the same offence, the gangster had been freed even after being nabbed by crime branch, due to alleged political influence and support of a builder. In the Tandulkar murder, police said the assailants wanted to eliminate one Dinesh Pandey, also an autorickshaw driver, to teach him a lesson for confronting them earlier in the day. The three assailants are trying to establish their dominance at the autorickshaw stand, and Pandey had abused Singh in a lighter vein earlier in the day. It’s learnt that Tandulkar, whose cousin is posted at crime branch, too had a wordy duel with Vicky earlier in the day. Later, Pandey and Singh, who were once classmates, exchanged abuse at the autorickshaw stand at Rani Jhansi Chowk. They were separated by Tandulkar before he left to attend a family programme at Timki. In Tandulkar’s absence, Dabekar assaulted Pandey with a sword on his right shoulder. Pandey went to a hospital at Hingna and informed Tandulkar and another autorickshaw driver Chandrakant Bhagwat. Tandulkar and Bhagwat rushed to the hospital, picked up Pandey and dropped him home safely. Some time later, Tandulkar got a call on his cell phone from Kuryavanshi, who summoned him to Udibaba Chowk. Kuryavanshi and Dabekar wanted Tandulkar to call Pandey too at the spot. Tandulkar reached the spot but kept pleading with the assailants to forgive Pandey and forget the incident. As Kuryavanshi and Dabekar started getting aggressive, Tandulkar tried to sneak away in Bhagwat’s autorickshaw. But Kuryavanshi and Dabekar attacked Tandulkar, and while Singh thrashed Tandulkar, Dabekar assaulted him with a sword. MIDC police have registered an offence of murder against four persons, including the three already in custody. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Go for physiotherapy, fix your career im.description: Physiotherapy enhances quality of life through examinations and diagnosis. This primary care treatment also includes research and consultation A flexible body always contributes to leading a healthy life. Even the slightest ache in any single bone leads to surgery if the path has been wavered with ignorance. Physiotherapy is a profession which helps in curing every little bodily disturbance with ease and relaxation. A time-to-time check-up and a regular five-minute exercise is all what a physiotherapist asks for. Physiotherapy enhances quality of life through examinations and diagnosis. This primary care treatment also includes research, consultation and administration professions. Sports physiotherapist Dr Sumit Meshram said, “Physiotherapy is an evolving field in today’s generation. This field of work is related to physical mobility of a person. Knowledge on how to deal with minor injuries is taught in physiotherapy. No sports player can function without regular exercise and physiotherapy.” “This field also helps in preventing major traumas that often happen due to ignorance of short-term pains. An alternative to medicines is physiotherapy. This exercise-related treatment is quite helpful in avoiding medicinal indulgence,” he said. Physiotherapy does not only mean exercises; there are a variety of subjects and branches offered. Dr. Bhagyashri Hajare, a neuro development therapist, said, “This field is one of the leading professions in India and abroad. Almost everyone today is a fitness lover and requires proper diet, along with a proper body. To maintain a healthy life, everyone invests in a physiotherapist without thinking twice.” “It includes many branches of which the most trending are paediatric neuro, adult neuro, physiotherapist in orthopaedics, community-based rehabilitations, cardio physiotherapist, sports physiotherapist and so on. Along with the degree, there are separate certification courses which help in securing a heavily paid job in different countries. Being a physiotherapist requires both knowledge of the study as well as how to gain a patient’s everlasting trust,” she said. Apart from physiotherapy, another interesting branch called ‘occupational therapy’ has come into consideration where, along with physiotherapy, consultations and psychiatry are looked upon excessively. But there are only a limited number of colleges in the country teaching this course. Dr Sana Khan, an occupational therapist, said, “Occupational therapy is an emerging theme since it deals with mental health, along with physique. An occupational therapist deals with quality of life of a patient as one cannot achieve full treatment until done with activities of daily living. This profession gives an adaption to life. An occupational therapist can work all over the world and has a good pay scale. This field is exceptionally good with rehabilitations, which most people are unaware of.” Why opt for the subjectHelp those who are in pain Lucrative and rewarding Decent salary Safe and trusted profession Expert View | Dr Ashish AgrawalProfession now evolving at great speedPhysiotherapy is a branch of medical studies that involves providing remedies to any part of the body that has discomfort. Physiotherapy promotes mobility. This physical therapy takes care of curing minor bone fractures or disorders. Everybody today survives with the help of a physiotherapists who recommend regular exercises. This leading profession is now evolving at great speed every day. Developments and supreme technologies have made a huge impact on this study. Everyday, an entirely new research comes into consideration which has improved the quality of medical sciences on the whole. Physiotherapy is a really good choice for even those who have an interest in the field of sports as a sportsman compulsorily needs a physiotherapist on a daily basis. Sports physiotherapy is one such branch which gives physiotherapist an opportunity to deal with a sportsperson on and off the field. Ensuring “return to play” is one of the biggest challenges for a sports physiotherapist, because every sportsman wants to play as early as possible. It’s quite satisfying for a physiotherapist to make the sportsman play after an injury and perform well. Advancements and progress never have a full stop in this fast, developing world. Everyday, people are being introduced to something they never saw coming. Physiotherapy nowadays offers different post graduate courses in the form of sports, manual, geriatric, paediatric, neuroscience, musculoskeletal, cardio-respiratory, hand, women’s health etc. Being a physiotherapist is a great choice since it gives a better view of looking over at life and health. (Dr Agrawal is a physiotherapist and Level 1 BCCI physio) List of collegesDatta Meghe College of Physiotherapy Courses offered: BPTh (Bachelor of Physiotherapy) Duration: 4 years + 6 months internship Admission procedure: Candidates are required to appear for an entrance test i.e. National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) Source: College website Niharikaa College of Physiotherapy Courses Offered: BPTh Duration: 4 years + 6 months internship Admission procedure: Candidates are required to appear for NEET Source: Dr Sujit Nath Banerjee, secretary of the college Government Medical College, Nagpur Courses Offered: BPTh Duration: 4 years + 6 months internship Admission procedure: NEET Source: College website This list is not exhaustive and should not be considered as the endorsement of the institute. Students are advised to check with relevant education authorities before taking admission PROFESSIONALS SPEAKPhysiotherapy is a medical field where we deal with pain in the body, be it of muscles or bones. It is very hard and laborious field. But it is always a pleasure to be rewarded with elation when people get cured, especially if they are children or senior citizens Dr Maneesha Deshpande Physiotherapy is not what it was once. In fact, the industry has grown quite a lot and awareness about it is increasing too. The study is hard but I feel that more and more youths should participate in it and opt for it as their career Dr Neena Sahu From my experience in the past 15 years, I feel people are now more conscious about what physiotherapy is and what it can do. It is about hard work and patience. No one has succeeded in this field by hurrying their way Dr Vaishali Kalbande To all the aspirants of physiotherapy, I would like to suggest that it is not easy to make it big in this industry without patience and labour. I advise you to do your work with all honesty and not let your patients return disappointed Dr Naveen Bhagat Physiotherapy is a difficult career to pursue. However, health is the harmony of body and mind and a physiotherapist can really help you in bringing peace in both. As a physiotherapist, I will always recommend this branch of medical science Dr Vikas Prem Mahobiya (Compiled by Manshika Vaikkath, Anchal Bhatia, Shristi Sankrit & Amrit Parida) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Singing show winner Sugandha is now an i.description: NAGPUR: Fourteen-year-old Sugandha Date, who recently clinched the top prize in a television reality show, is already an internet sensation with 14,000 followers. This was the second attempt by Sugandha on television, the earlier being one in 2013, when she was barely six and was among the top five finalists. Often compared to popular playback singer Shreya Ghoshal, Sugandha, who hails from Nagpur, won hearts especially with her rendition of songs like ‘Dhadak’, ‘Bhaire Naina’ and ‘Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam’. “Though she missed the trophy in 2013 this win has more than made up for it,” said her mother Amruta. Already in exam mode as she prepares for her Std X boards next year, Sugandha says she is not affected by the attention that comes her way through Instagram, where she 14,800 followers. The number of those viewing her videos of rehearsals and highlights of her performance rose to 35,000 after she won the trophy. “Instagram and Facebook help build an image beyond the show, but it only works if the talent is real,” Amruta said. Sugandha has at least five fan club pages on Instagram and Facebook. “But for now, she is only concentrating on her training with her guru Anand Sharma and her studies,” her mother said. Rotary Vision financial aid for needy st.description: NAGPUR: The Rotary Club of Nagpur Vision (RCNV), in association with TOI, will be offering scholarships to Std X and XII students who, despite their underprivileged conditions, performed well in this year’s board exams. Around 160 students will receive financial assistance up to Rs3,000 and will be felicitated at special event scheduled for June 28. Under their Project Smiling Faces, RCNV hopes to make a difference to the lives of children who would have otherwise lost out on education. Rajiv Behal, president of RCNV, said their focus was on enabling such students to continue their education. “Scholarships are given to students who struggle to continue education due to financial constraints as their families are unable to pay expenses and basic needs. We want students to get educated so they are able to live their lives in a respectable way,” he said. RCNV hopes that with the financial assistance, the need to do odd jobs will not be there. Ajay Uplanchiwar, director of Project Smiling Faces, said, “The aim of the project is to provide scholarship to the high school graduates so they can build a better future and not do odd jobs. We have been doing this for the last two years to recognize underprivileged children and give them a better future.” Since these youngsters are unable to fend for themselves, RCNV believes it is important to lend them a helping hand. Nilanjan Bhowmick, chairperson, Project Smiling Faces, said, “The underprivileged children lack the support system that others have. We need to help them achieve their goals and that is what RCNV is trying to do.” RCNV has appealed to the public to inform them about underprivileged kids who deserve this scholarship. Information is to be shared with Bhowmick on Ph 9657552244 and/or at nilanjanbhowmick@gmail.com. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Patients miss appointments, but show sol.description: NAGPUR: The one-day strike by private doctors in the city created problems for those patients who had sought prior appointments for regular check-ups and treatment. Unaware about the strike, patients reached clinics as per their scheduled time only to be told by the on-duty staff that doctors will not be available for the day. “I thought only corporate hospitals are on strike and not the smaller clinics. So, I came for my regular check-up. The clinic was open but I was told that non-essential services have been withdrawn for a day. I was given an appointment for tomorrow morning,” said Prakash Kulkarni, a senior citizen from Narendra Nagar. There are many hospitals in Dhantoli where patients come from different places with prior appointments months in advance. Many of these hospitals claimed that they informed patients about the strike and rescheduled their appointments. Many corporate hospitals also made it a point to check and treat patients coming from rural areas and other states to avoid inconvenience. “In fact, we admitted 17 patients today. We conducted three surgeries on trauma patients who came all the way from Betul and Chandrapur,” said Dr Sameer Paltewar of Meditrina hospital. “The OPD was closed. Not a single patient was checked. In fact, patients, too, cooperated,” he added. Non-availability of diagnostic services was a major problem for patients. Staff and technicians were available at CT scan centres and pathology labs. In many cases, they took blood samples and conducted scans but they refused to give reports before Tuesday if it was not an emergency. “Reports of several diagnostic scans and blood tests were provided instantly. We were asked to come tomorrow if it was not a case of emergency,” said Sushila Bhagat, a patient. Most of the patients expressed their solidarity with the doctors. “They are life givers and nobody has the right to attack them. How can we lose a trained doctor who can save hundreds of lives in a mob fury? There should be a central law with provisions of strict punishment in case of violence against doctors,” said Dr Dilip Dabir, a retired professor. Bhagwat raps Mamata for Bengal violence,.description: Nagpur: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat obliquely hit out at West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee for the post election violence in the state which has left BJP workers killed. Addressing the annual passing out parade of the final year course of RSS workers on Sunday, Bhagwat said the violence was unacceptable and animosity should have ended with the elections. “Each one should work together for the country’s development,” he said. In his first major public speech after general elections, Bhagwat who made sharp remarks at opposition, however, also cautioned the ruling party against being complacent. Without naming BJP or any other party, he said the “people have bought them to power again hoping that certain aspirations which were left out in the last tenure will be met now. So, it is the utmost duty of those in power to live up to the people’s expectations.” “The public has become wiser these days and does not get carried away by political promises. This time the people have voted cutting across the divides of society,” he said. This year’s annual passing out ceremony of the RSS remained a rather low-key affair with no chief guest from outside the organization sharing the dais. Last year, veteran Congressman and former President Pranab Mukherjee was the chief guest. This had led to a political stir. This time business baron Rata Tata was invited who did not make it to the function. “The party which has come to power has got a stronger mandate in the fresh tenure. This means the people have reposed higher faith in the party. Some of the promises they had made were kept and some remained to be fulfilled,” he said. “It seems that some have not been able to digest their defeat. Look at what is taking place in Bengal. It is the responsibility of those at the helm to prevent such happenings. Those who have lost should take the defeat sportingly and the winners should also not be taken over by pride,” said Bhagwat. “It’s perhaps the fear of losing the next elections that has led to violence against political workers. After all these are just elections in which parties only compete to win people’s mandate and this is no war where any bloodshed takes place,” he said. Saying that certain elements are trying to divide the nation for their vested interests, Bhagwat said if they succeed, what was achieved after 70 years of Independence would be wiped out soon. He warned the ruling party of the Trojan horse in the hiding. Bhagwat also evoked Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar citing that he had stressed brotherhood was the need of hour to keep the freedom intact. “Both freedom and equality cannot come in equal measure. To maintain a balance between the two what the country needed was brotherhood,” he said citing Ambedkar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur University okays contract teacher.description: NAGPUR: The Nagpur University (NU) management council on Saturday finalized the process to appoint 107 assistant professors on contractual basis without approving the roster either by the government or the deputy divisional commissioner (revenue). Officials said the roster was approved by the vice chancellor using his special powers as per the Act. They said government or commissioner’s approval was not required since these posts were not regular. “The requirement keeps changing every year. Hence government approval is exempted as per a GR,” they said. This is the second year when the NU would be hiring teachers on contractual basis. Last year too, the NU’s move had attracted allegations of malpractices and violation of UGC norms. Though several objections were raised, the top brass went ahead with the appointments. On May 20, in its Board of Deans (BoD) meeting, presided over by pro-VC Pramod Yeole, the university decided to hire 107 teachers on 11-month contract where they would be paid remuneration of Rs24,000/month. The number has gone up by 15 compared to 92 last year. The teachers would work at 40 NU departments and conducted colleges, including Laxminarayan Institute of Technology (LIT), Sheshrao Wankhede BEd College and Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Law College. The moratorium on recruitment had been adversely affecting NU’s functioning. NU had received an overwhelming response with over 700 applications of which 432 were found eligible. Despite this, the appointment of 92 teachers last year was delayed by about six months. The actual teaching started from November end and the tenure concluded on April 30. NU officials said that the university was paying the teachers’ salaries from its general funds. Last year, management council members RG Bhoyar and Nitin Kongre had strongly opposed the move citing several shortcomings. They had said they were not against the filling up of 92 posts but only wanted the NU to reconsider its own norms which were in violation of UGC guidelines. The duo of Bhoyar-Kongre ripped apart the committee entrusted with framing the terms and conditions for the appointment and called the entire exercise as big illegality. Anantnag Encounter.description: SRINAGAR: An Army Major died while another officer of the same rank and two soldiers were injured in a gunfight at Bidoora village, in Achabal area of south Kashmir's Anantnag district, on Monday, a defence spokesman said. A Pakistani terrorist was killed in the encounter. Major Ketan Sharma of 19 Rashtriya Rifles, who died in the Achabal encounter, belonged to Meerut. A police officer said they had found the body of a Pakistani terrorist and seized arms and ammunition from the encounter site. The identity of the slain terrorist was being ascertained. In another attack, at least nine Army soldiers were injured in an IED blast that targeted a security vehicle of 44 RR at Aarihal village in Pulwama on Monday evening. Those injured in the Achabal gunfight and IED blast were rushed to the Army's 92 Base hospital in Srinagar, officials said. In the third attack in 24 hours, terrorists lobbed a grenade at the headquarters of the 180 CRPF battalion camp in Tral sub-district of Pulwama late on Monday evening. The grenade exploded outside the headquarters. No casualties have been reported. The first attack happened on Monday morning when a team of security men was on a cordon-and-search operation in Achabal. Terrorists fired at the team, who then retaliated. In the Pulwama attack, the terrorists after setting off the IED, opened fire at the Army vehicle. "Initial reports reveal the vehicle suffered extensive damage," the official said. Three of the soldiers injured in the blast were said to be serious, sources said. Soon after the attack, Army, police and SOG reinforcements were rushed to the spot and a massive search operation was launched. A defence spokesman, however, said some of the men sustained minor injuries in the IED blast. Damage was minimal due to the alertness of the patrol party, he said. The vehicle was an armoured ALS and not a Casspir (a mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicle), he added. 18 months on, Smart City Wi-Fi still not.description: NAGPUR: Around 889 Wi-Fi access points were established across the city under the Rs520 crore Smart and Safe City Project over 18 months ago. Unfortunately, Wi-Fi services are yet to become fully operational. Nagpur Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) special purpose vehicle for Smart City Project — Nagpur Smart and Sustainable City Development Corporation Limited (NSSCDCL) — through private operator L&T Construction’s Smart World and Communication Unit was supposed to provide Wi-Fi free of cost for 30 minutes, followed by charged access. For the last over 18 months, Wi-Fi for 30 minutes or up to 200 MB data is being provided free of cost at the 889 access points. But the main service of providing Wi-Fi after 30 minutes or at the end of 200 MB free data by taking charges has not been made operational. NMC sources told TOI Wi-Fi service could not be made completely operational just for want of payment gateway. “NSSCDCL and L&T were supposed to enter into an agreement with a bank for payment gateway. This simple process could not be completed in over 18 months,” sources said. Municipal commissioner Abhijit Bangar confirmed that Wi-Fi service was not available after 30 minutes or 200 MB. “I came to know about it recently. I have directed NSSCDCL officials to ensure payment gateway is operational as soon as possible. We will make it operational soon,” he said. Wi-Fi service under Smart and Safe City Project can be beneficial for individuals, institutions and commercial units across the city due to its high speed. An optical fibre cable of 600km has been laid under Smart and Safe City Project. Wi-Fi access points are connected with this network. Therefore, the speed of internet service is 10 MBPS. Also, Wi-Fi access points are established at major squares of the city in busy market places, commercial, administrative zones etc As reported by TOI on April 10, NMC head office and zone offices too were supposed to get free internet service at the speed of 10 MBPS under Smart and Safe City Project, but this has not been possible till date. The civic body is paying high charges to various operators to get internet in its offices. Bangar said this problem will also be solved soon. “I have directed NMC officials to coordinate with NSSCDCL officials and ensure internet services from Smart and Safe City Project,” he said. There are a few more components of Smart and Safe City Project which are yet to be made operational. One of these services is Smart Parking developed along Central Bazaar Road at Ramdaspeth. It is pending just for want of appointment of an agency for operation and maintenance. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NMC reduces power bill by 52% after LED.description: NAGPUR: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) LED street lights project has started to yield good results. Power consumption has reduced by 52.41% even though the project is yet to be completed. NMC said 1.28 lakh of total 1.43 lakh street lights have been converted from sodium vapour to LED. The civic body is planning to finish the work on remaining 15,000 street lights within a month. An NMC official told TOI the power bill for street lights has come down to Rs2.28 crore per month (Rs27.36 crore per annum) from earlier billing of Rs4.35 crore per month (Rs52.20 crore per annum). This is a saving of Rs2.07 crore per month (Rs24.84 crore per annum). “The power bill will further reduce once the entire project is completed,” he said. NMC has replaced 60 watt sodium vapour bulb with 36 watt LEDs on internal roads, and 60 watt, 105 watt and 120 watt sodium vapour lamps on major roads, squares and playgrounds with 285 watt LEDs. Apart from saving power by conversion into LED, NMC has installed a system where street lights are dimmed by 40% by 10pm and 50% by midnight. This is done automatically. NMC officials added the automatic switch-on and switch-off system will further reduce power consumption of street lights. “Under the same project, we will install a system to automatically start street lights after sunset and switch-off by sunrise. Also, timings will be set properly in the system,” he said. For decades, street lights have been seen burning well before sunset, especially during summer days, wasting power. The total cost of the LED project is Rs470 crore of which Rs277 crore is for installing LED systems. Also, NMC aims to ensure majority street lights are included in the project. NMC is spending Rs59 crore on infrastructure development, where old power cables and street light poles will be replaced. Also, NMC is spending Rs28 crore for new street light infrastructure on under-construction Inner Ring Road and Metro rail corridors. NMC is executing all these works through eight private companies. It is mandatory for the companies to operate and maintain the street lights for 99 months, for which they will be paid Rs106 crore. With all these works, NMC is confident of proper functioning of street lights. An NMC official said the project will lead to a profit for the civic body. “NMC will get LED street lights, new infrastructure and systems without spending anything. Entire cost of the project will be recovered from savings in power bills and high cost of current annual maintenance,” he said. However, the project has been delayed to some extent due to delays in getting permission from the state government for seeking loans, ongoing works on Inner Ring Road Cement Concrete project, flyovers and Metro Rail. The works to install LED street lights was supposed to be completed by August 2018. NMC has also issued work orders to private companies for operating all these street lights on solar. Expense on power bill will go down further while also benefiting the environment. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tadoba to close core, buffer to remain o.description: CHANDRAPUR: The core zone of Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve will close down for monsoon from July 1. Park management is, however, going to continue with full-fledged tourism in buffer zone of the tiger reserve during the monsoon. Tadoba has become an internationally acclaimed tiger destination and people from across the world come here to see tigers in the wild. Tadoba once again registered rise in tourist numbers during last year. The number of tourist visitors during year 2018-19 has crossed the 1.75 lakh mark. Even sizzling temperature of 47 degree in Chandrapur failed to deter tourists during the summer. More than 60,000 tourists have visited Tadoba since May 1, sources said. However, TATR management has decided for full closure of the core zone of the park during the monsoon months, complying with directives of NTCA. However, tourists will be able to enjoy tiger safari in buffer, which have equally good tiger population. Park management is going to offer entry into the buffer circuits from seven gates during the monsoon months. Tourists will have choice of online as well as spot booking for safari in buffer zone. Deputy director, TATR (buffer) sent a letter to project coordinator of Maha Online Company Ltd requesting to open online booking for seven gates in four ranges in buffer zone. Mahaecotourism portal is likely to open bookings for seven buffer gates at Agarzari, Devada-Adegaon, Alijhanjha, Ramdegi-Navegaon, Kolara, Kolara-Madnapur and Mamla zones in four buffer ranges. Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Faulty vehicle driver gets eight-day ban.description: NNTR officials have handed a eight-day ban for the driver whose gypsy broke down on June 11 evening in the core area following which the tourist had to walk for almost 4km to seek help. The ban is for driving a faulty vehicle and NNTR officials clarified that there is no connection to allegations of harassment made by the tourist. NNTR Deputy director (core) Poonam Pate said “We have finished the inquiry and found that the allegations were exaggerated. The timings of vehicle’s entry and exit were rechecked and there does not seem to be any major delay in helping the tourist.” About allegations about the tourist having to shell out extra cash, Pate said it was result of confusion. “The driver, who was supposed to pay the fine, did not have any cash on him and that’s why the tourist paid up. I reiterate, that this entire incident should not have happened and it’s unfortunate that it did,” said Pate. TOI had reported earlier this week about how 53 year-old tourist Ajay Agarwal was forced to walk in darkness inside the core area to reach a camp office for a rescue vehicle. CBSE-state board confrontation looms lar.description: NAGPUR: The Centralized Admission Process (CAP) for Std XI is yet to begin even though SSC results were declared on June 8. The hold-up at state level is because of growing concerns that the state board students will lose out on seats in good colleges because their CBSE counterparts have scored ‘high marks’ in the board exams. The state education officials have been brainstorming about various options to solve the problem, but so far nothing concrete has been done. Options such as considering only CBSE theory marks and increasing seats for 2019-20 academic session only are being discussed by officials. Academicians feel that this is an unnecessary controversy which is only hurting students. Reena Dargan, principal of Ira International School, said, “First of all there is an assumption that CBSE schools have marked the papers leniently, which is incorrect. Everything is done as per the model answer paper. It’s natural for confrontations to happen between two boards but to drag matters into a public forum is not done.” Dilip Bose, general secretary of School Headmasters Charitable Association, said, “This delay is not only unwarranted but also detrimental for academic future of students. The delay in admission process means delay in wrapping it up. Then automatically, the classes will start late and we will struggle to finish the course on time. And if poor results come then who will be blamed?”. Another senior state board school principal agreed that the issue was being blown out of proportion. “We had about 15,000-plus seats going vacant in Nagpur last year in Std XI, so why should there be such a hue and cry. There are ample seats available across all streams. There is no logical reason for people to stop the admission process,” she said. In Nagpur, science students usually go by whatever their coaching classes say and take admission there. Even otherwise, in the city, the craze for specific college does not exist. Obscure junior colleges in city are known to have more than double the enrolment of old and ‘branded’ colleges, simply because of their tie-up with coaching classes. In this scenario, the delay of admission process in Nagpur does not seem logical. An education department employee, who did not wish to be identified, said, “Since we are connected to the same admission software, the rules will have to be the same as well.” If at all the state education officials decide to not consider CBSE’s internal marks for Std XI admissions, then it will be the second major showdown between the two boards. The first was in 2011 when CBSE students who had appeared for the school-based exam in Std X were denied admission in Std XI of the state board junior colleges. At that time, the state board had raised questions about the credibility of school-based exam in which 100% marks were internally evaluated. The controversy ended only after a lobby group from Nagpur, that included parents, a cabinet minister and schools owners sorted out the issue with the then school education minister Rajendra Darda. Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23.
