Various hues of life depicted in 10 play.description: NAGPUR: Humour, satire and emotions which are inseparable part of life were on display during the ten plays presented in Sugar and Spice round IX, organized by Stagecraft at Matoshri Vimlatai Deshmukh Sabhagruh, Dhanwate National College, on Saturday. The event started with an emotional thought-provoking drama ‘Meri Dadi Kahan Hai’, directed by Anurima Chakraborty. The play is about a little girl Khushi Mohta who is in search of her grandmother (Jigyasa Bharti). In the process, the girl takes help from an autowala, rabbit, dog, tortoise, lion and bear. The actors were Samvardhan Khandelwal, Ismat Chimthanawala, Viraj Shah, Arundhati Jogdand, Rahul Bhojwani and Pratiksha Kaleshwarwar. The play was written by Padmashree Pande. ‘Happy Meal’, directed by Shivani Joshi and written by Shubhankar Mishra, was full of humour. A girl (Devika Patel) and her friend (Amol Wakhare) have a magic apple through which they can go to any place they wish to. But as an argument ensues, the girl throws away the apple. They are now stuck on a cold mountain peak, but then mother comes to their rescue and gives them a mango through which they can travel even to outer space. ‘Ek Chhoti Si Khwaish’, a satire on the condition of a student, written by Raunak Madne and directed by Anu Sabharwal, tells the story of a girl (Ruhi Khanuja) who is burdened by the wishes of her mother (Anurima Chakraborty) to become a doctor. But her teacher (Anurima Chakraborty) thinks she is dumb. The girl struggles to fulfil her mother’s dream but eventually ends up into depression. ‘Conversations’, directed by Rajat Rajani, dealt with standing up for self and being proud of who you are, was about a young woman (Ayushi Vairagade) opening up to her mother (Maria Shakir) and sister (Avni Jog) being gay. Harshit Verma played the role of a waiter. ‘Chidiya Udd’ was a satire on how today’s generation has lost childhood under the burden of tuition classes and extra-curricular activities. The play, written by Nitish Chandra, was directed by NV Sharma. The cast included Tahir Shibam, Swati Lohe, Riddhi Lohe and Huzefa Kotawala. Another satire, ‘Three Monkeys & A Like Button’ was based on how our life is being directed by a ‘like’ button of Facebook. The play was written by Jaya Girathe and directed by Maria Shakir. The cast included Shaima Patel, Neelam Singh and Manank Panchmatia. Emotional play ‘Remembering My Grandmother’ was written by Jaee Jog and directed by Neha Khanzode. The cast included Nivedita Jogdand, Shivani Joshi and Rahul Bhojwani. ‘Nowhere to Play’, written by Bianca Nazareth-Arya and directed by Sonal Bindra, was a satire on how children today do not have a place to play. The cast included Vardaan Anand, Parthiv Banerjee, Harsh Dayaramani and Anu Sabharwal. ‘Loose’ was about how if our parents become care free and never tell us to study and let us do as we wish. The play was written by Onkar Ghare and directed by Sanskruti Bajoria. Shika Kalra, Madhvi Ambhore and Kuldeep Lohe were the actors. Audience laughed heartily when ‘Andher Nagri Chopat Raja’, written by Shantanu Thengdi and directed by Taher Shibam, was staged. The cast included Samson Aiyub, Shlok Vij, Lalit Ghavghave, Ashwin Shukla, Namrata Shukla, Manank Panchmatia, Sana Thombre and Shubham Veergandham. Lalit. Ghavghave stole the show with his quick wit. (Reporting by Himesh Pande) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nGovernment Chitrakala Mahavidyalaya ho.description: There was a flurry of excitement among the students and teaching staff of Government Chitrakala Mahavidyalaya at their recently organised cultural fiesta —Aakar—where everyone enjoyed cultural treats, entertaining acts and fun-filled competitions. The discerning audience enjoyed a fine bouquet of performing arts and shared a good time interacting with one another on this occasion.  “This fest is a melting pot of various art forms and the students have been given a great platform by the college to exhibit their talent. From traditional dance performances to skits, mono acts, painting exhibitions to food stalls, there was a fine mix of everything for people to enjoy,” said lecturer Kishore Ingale.  We spotted principal of the college Vinod Mankar and educationists Subhash Babhulkar, Vikash Joshi, Rakesh Pathrabe and Rajendra Giri having a good time at the fiesta. Nagpur\u2019s Confidence Petroleum plans.description: Nagpur: City-based Confidence Petroleum, dubbed as the largest stand-alone auto LPG supplier, plans to invest Rs500 crore for expansion in the next two years. Rs250 crore will be pumped in every year. The company, which has been trading in the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) since 1995, also got listed at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) last week. The company’s share is now being traded at Rs38.5 with a trading volume of around 3 lakh shares. It has a paid up value of Re 1. Talking to TOI in light of the listing at NSE, chairman Nitin Khara said the company has 196 auto LPG filling stations in different states. There are plans to take it to 500 stations in Nagpur where there are five centres which would be doubled during the expansion drive. Apart from Maharashtra, the company plans to have additional auto LPG stations in Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh. “The company already has its presence in most of these states, which would be further strengthened,” said Khara. Apart from the main cities in these states, there are plans to start auto LPG filling centres in tehsils and Tier III towns also. This will happen in Maharashtra, too, he added. Out of the Rs500 crore planned to be invested, Rs300 crore will go into setting up a bottling plant. Confidence Petroleum is at present a debt free company and would be funding it expansion through internal accruals apart from raising loans. On the listing at NSE he said it was pending because shares which formed a major stake held in his mother’s name remained in physical form. Khara said that as his mother expired in 2011, it took time to settle the formalities related to the will after which the shares held in her name were dematised. Listing in NSE was only possible after that. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Metro is running but has no stations to.description: NAGPUR: Even though three reaches of Nagpur Metro might become operational by mid-2020, it would take some months before all the stations become functional. Thus, in real sense, the project might be fully operational only in 2021. A source in MahaMetro said work on many stations was stuck due to land acquisition problems. "In the Sitabuldi to Khapri stretch, Ujjwal Nagar station is in trouble as land required on one side is stuck in litigation. Five stations are already operational on this reach while the remaining five will be gradually opened for the public by this year-end," he added. MahaMetro’s station contractor for this reach — ILFS — has gone bust leaving the work in limbo. The contracts were retendered and now work is on in full swing again. On Prajapati Nagar to Sitabuldi stretch, Prajapati Nagar station itself is stuck as the owner of Rehana Steel, whose land is required, is demanding a higher amount than that fixed by the district collector. "Negotiations are going on and we are trying to persuade the owner not to ask for a higher price," said the source. In general, work of this stretch (Reach IV) has been affected due to labour shortage. "Over 70% of construction workers employed for this reach are from outside. They had gone to their native villages to vote, and have started returning only just now. Work will begin in full swing only after some weeks when all of them are back on the job," the official said. The entire Reach II (Sitabuldi to Automotive Square stretch) is stuck since National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) is yet to sanction the double decker flyover on this stretch. The flyover was to begin from a point near SFS Church but due to opposition from locals it has been moved to LIC Square. However, four multi-storied buildings have to be acquired for it now. "We have stopped the work of most stations on Reach II as there is no clarity on the flyover. Work will begin only after NHAI gives the green signal," the source said. In addition, two stations have land problems too. "The owners of land on one side of Automotive Square station are not willing to hand it over. The Ambedkar Square station is stuck as there is legal dispute among family members over the ownership of the land," said the source. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gadchiroli SP gifts drinking water to re.description: NAGPUR: A remote tribal village in Maoist-affected Dhanora tehsil in north Gadchiroli got an unusual gift from superintendent of police (SP) Shailesh Balkawade. He brightened the lives of 400-450 villagers by bringing water to their doorstep at a time when the nearest ‘nullah’ outside the hamlet and a rickety hand pump both had gone dry in the harsh summer this year. Within a fortnight of Balkawade’s visit to Katejhari on May 29, two bore wells were dug at the village and a storage tank constructed. Around 20-22 taps, installed at intermittent distances, would now get water. Though his original mission was to visit the highly sensitive Katejhari village to meet family members of a Maoist and also the villagers, the district police chief won the hearts of the villagers with his water diplomacy. The village is known for its outright support for Maoists. But Balkawade proved that anti-Maoist operations need not always be with guns and grenades. The project, funded under the civic action programme of cops, turned out to be such a big occasion that the villagers wanted it to be inaugurated quickly. Instead of any officer or politician, it was one of the villagers, Bhimaji Kolhe, who inaugurated the water project on Friday. While Kolhe did the honours, the officers of Katejhari armed out post (AOP) sub-inspectors Akshaykumar Gorad, Sagar Warute and Jagannath Menkudle were cheering the event. Balkawade said he had gone to Katejhari to convince the family of a Maoist to surrender under the ‘Navjeevan' programme and also meet the villagers under ‘grambhet’ (village meet) to ask them about their grievances. “It was when I had just started to come back that some women and children approached me with two things. One, they had mentioned about drinking water problem and the other one was the deplorable condition of the Katejhari-Murumgaon road which is riddled with trenches and big pot holes,” he said. “The problem of drinking water was solved within a short period and now we are also pushing for the repair of the connecting road through our special funds. Providing drinking water was our priority as there was no provision available from where the villagers could draw water and given the heat their lives seemed to have become very tough in that dry terrain,” said the Balkawade. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Facebook live records accident; two dead.description: Nagpur: A joyride turn tragic after two brothers who were on their way to a pool party at a farm house in Katol died while seven others were injured after the SUV they were travelling in met with an accident on Sunday evening near Hatlagaon. The incident was also recorded in a video as the youths were sharing a live feed on Facebook while they were on their way to the party. All the nine friends were on way to attend a party in Katol from city when the incident happened The video procured by TOI shows, Punkesh Patil, 25, driving the car while his brother Sanket was sitting beside him. One of his friends, sitting on back seat, was recording the video of the route as a rap song was playing in the background. The video shows Punkesh was trying to overtake a car which was already overtaking another car. It had led the SUV to the far right side of the road, before Punkesh lost control and the SUV met with an accident. According to police, Punkesh lost the control of the speeding SUV due to which it went on the far right of the road before it summer salted twice before hitting a tree. The incident was spotted by several villagers who soon informed police control room. Katol police rushed to the spot and sent the injured to hospital while both the brothers died on spot. Till late night, police had not registered any offence in the matter. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Women-only e-buses to join Aapli Bus fle.description: NAGPUR: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) transport department has placed an order to purchase five electric buses. The e-buses, which will be pink in colour, will ferry women passengers only. The buses will be added to NMC’s Aapli Bus fleet by July end, said transport committee chairman Bunty Kukde. The 32-seater midi bus will cost around Rs 1.29 crore each. The civic body had received Rs9.60 crore grant from the state government to ply women-only buses under Tejaswani Scheme. Kukde said earlier the civic body had decided to purchase diesel buses, but later decided to purchase electric buses as it will reduce the expenditure substantially and will cause no pollution. Currently, the NMC is plying 328 buses and has no women-only buses. It was a long-pending demand from women commuters to operate special buses for them. Sources said the NMC had received funds from the state government in early 2017. But the civic administration had exhausted the funds. Following directives from Kukde, the administration has made financial provision for electric buses. Kukde said the NMC has started the process to set up a charging station at NMC’s land on old Bhandara Road in Lakadganj area. The charging station can accommodate three buses at a time. Each bus needs three hours for charging and can run for almost 200km. According to Kukde, a bus will consume a unit to run a kilometre. This will curb NMC’s expenditure on city bus transportation significantly as the costing of one unit of power is around Rs12. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Encephalitis.description: Bihar is in the grip of Encephalitis. At least 108 children have lost their lives due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in its Muzaffarpur district. AES accompanies flu-like symptoms such as high fever, headaches and convulsions. Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is the major cause of AES in India besides other sources such as bacteria, fungus, parasites, spirochetes, chemicals, toxins, and non infectious agents. Here's more. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. \nRaisoni College organises get-together.description: A get-together organised recently by the Raisoni College of Commerce, Science and Technology was high on fun and camaraderie.  The power-packed event had many entertaining acts and interesting games. Divided in different teams, students donned various superhero tees and brought forth their competitive streak in various games like truth or dare and musical chairs. Impromptu colourful dances, singing and humourous skits added entertainment to the do. The Raisonians, being the sport they are, performed all the tasks with great enthusiasm. The youngsters later were spotted clicking selfies and sharing light moments , bonding over refreshments. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Dist gets third minister as Fuke becomes.description: Nagpur: Hard work done for winning the Bhandara-Gondia Lok Sabha seat for BJP has paid off for MLC Parinay Fuke (a resident of Nagpur) as he has been appointed a minister of state by chief minister Devendra Fadnavis. He is the third minister from the district after the CM and energy minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule. He has been allocated the public works, tribal development and forest portfolios. Although Fuke will be a minister only till October, when assembly elections are scheduled, this appointment brightens his chance of becoming a minister in the new government should BJP-Shiv Sena retain power. Fuke started his political journey in 2007 when he was elected as an independent corporator. Between 2007 and 2012, he was in the opposition benches. However, he continued his close relationship with Fadnavis, who was then just a BJP MLA. After winning the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) election second time in 2012 he moved closer to BJP by joining the saffron party led Nagpur Vikas Aghadi. In 2016 he formally joined BJP and contested the legislative council elections from Bhandara-Gondia local body seat. He soundly defeated Rajendra Jain, a close aide of NCP stalwart Praful Patel. He managed to get a BJP ticket for NMC elections in 2017 and ensured his victory. Even though Fuke joined BJP in 2016 he was closely associated with Fadnavis since years. He help the CM during Vidhan Sabha elections in 2009 and 2014. Even while in the opposition in NMC, he rarely took an antigovernment stand and was considered to be a neutral. Fuke’s career in BJP received a boost when the then MP Nana Patole from Bhandara-Gondia quit the party in 2017 and joined Congress. The MLC emerged from Patole’s shadow to become a prominent leader in the two districts. The MLC had to bite dust when BJP lost the Lok Sabha assembly election from the constituency in May 2018. Patole and Patel had joined hands in the bypoll to ensure victory of their candidate Madhukar Kukde. Fuke however, did not lose heart and along with Bawankule he charged up the party workers for the general elections. Most political pundits felt that NCP would win from Bhandara-Gondia as BJP had lost the bypoll. However, the saffron candidate Sunil Mendhe won by 1.97 lakh votes giving a big boost to Fuke’s career. In fact Fuke had been offered the ticket but he refused. Fuke’s close association with TOI-MT Parinay Fuke was closely associated with TOI-MT during the Nag River campaign. He tabled a proposal in NMC House to name the square near TOI-MT office as ‘Times Square’. He then followed up with the administration to ensure that the proposal was implemented. Fuke got the road divider from Times Square to Laxmi Bhuvan Square painted and repaired the Nag River wall near TOI-MT office. He also helped the Group during its ‘Happy Streets’ event. Farmers\u2019 body gears up for sowing o.description: NAGPUR: Farmers’ organization Shetkari Sangathana has printed declaration forms on which it plans to get signatures of peasants across the state for planting illegal genetically modified variety of herbicide tolerant (HT) seeds in their fields. In what it calls to be a civil disobedience movement of its kind, the Sangathana has been pressing for free access to technology in agriculture including mass use of GM seeds. The HT seeds that have been developed by American biotech giant Monsanto are resistant to herbicides (weed killers), which have glyphosate as a key ingredient. Even the glyphosate-based herbicide has been developed by Monsanto. Shetkari Sangathana has been demanding that the government should allow use of HT seeds, as it will help them save a major cost on removal of weeds by deploying manual labour. However, experts say even if the seeds are allowed, cotton farmers may not be able to use HT variety legally. Former director of Central Institute of Cotton Research (CICR) Keshav Kranthi said that this is because glyphosate-based herbicide are only recommended for use in teal plantations and barren land. Without being allowed to use glyphosate, HT seeds not be of any use to the cotton grower. Kranthi now heads the technical section of International Cotton Advisory Council in the US. In its comment to an earlier report carried by TOI, even Monsanto had said, “In India, glyphosate-based herbicides have been recommended for use in general weed control in non-cropped areas such as tea and pre-plant rice. It should be used only as per the recommended guidelines.” Anil Ghanawat, President of Shetkari Sangathana, however said that glyphosate is non-selective herbicide and can also be used on the cotton crop. Shetkari Sangathana had started its campaign last week from Akoli Jahangir village of Akola district where farmer Lalit Bahale planted the seeds in front of police and 1,200 other farmers. If proven, this can lead to a five-year sentence. After that, farmers in districts like Wardha, Dhule and Ahmednagar have planted the seeds. This would be followed by farmers in Parbhani and Amravati. The declaration form prepared by the Sangathana will have details like farmers’ name, village and the area in which the seed has been planted. Shetkari Sangathana has been pressing that the government should allow use of HT seeds. However, after the trials, Monsanto itself had withdrawn its application in 2016. On this, Ghanawat said it was due to the low royalty it would have got on the seeds. “The Sangathana demands that the government should not intervene in the prices and give the technology provider a free hand letting the market decide the price,” he said. Private doctors on strike today, only e.description: NAGPUR: All doctors across the state will go on strike for 24 hours from 6am on Monday to 6am on Tuesday. All non-essential services, including OPDs, will be withdrawn but emergency and casualty services will continue to function. The strike has been called by the Indian Medical Association (IMA) and all private doctors attached to IMA have agreed to participate in it. In Nagpur city, all private hospitals, clinics and diagnostic labs will remain closed. Doctors are observing this strike to protest the attack on medicos at NRS Medical College in Kolkata on June 11. “All members of IMA have decided to meet at the IMA Hall in the afternoon. We will discuss further course of action during this meeting,” said Dr Manjusha Giri of Nagpur IMA. “All hospitals will be closed for general check-ups and lab testing. Patients should avoid visiting hospitals and clinics for regular check-ups or tests,” she added. The hospitals will reopen on Tuesday morning. The strike is gaining support from doctors practicing other schools of medicines too. On Sunday, National Integrated Medical Association, the apex body of doctors practicing ayurveda and unani also expressed its support to the strike. “NIMA members across Maharashtra will join the strike called by IMA on June 17. We also request the society to lend its support to doctors’ demands for safety and justice,” reads a statement issued by NIMA. Doctors from other districts in Vidarbha will also be on strike on Monday. IMA Yavatmal district president Dr Anoop Kothari told TOI that doctors in Yavatmal will attend only emergency patients during the one-day strike. “All members of IMA and other medical professionals will assemble at local Saraswat Chowk at 8am and start a silent march to the district collector’s office where a delegation will meet collector Ajay Gulhane and submit a memorandum of demands,” said Dr Kothari. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Private doctors pan India to strike work.description: NAGPUR: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) national body has called for closure of all non-essential services including the OPDs for 24 hours from 6am on Monday to 6am on Tuesday pan India in the private sector. Except for emergency and casualty services all diagnostic facilities in pathology, radiology etc will remain closed. The call comes following the ongoing agitation against the brutal attack on Dr Paribaha Mukherjee, by a violent mob at NRS Medical College, Kolkata. IMA is also observing nationwide protest on Saturday and Sunday by wearing black badges, taking out peaceful protest marches, dharnas and demonstrations. Dr Kush Jhunjhunwala, Nagpur IMA president said that IMA demands the biggest possible action by the West Bengal government. All the legitimate demands of the resident doctors in West Bengal should be accepted unconditionally. Dr Ashutosh Jadhav, general secretary of central MARD in state told TOI that on Monday all residents across India will wear helmets and black badges while working under the banner of the United Resident Doctors’ Association. IMA has requested all other associations of the fraternity to join in the struggle. IMA has been demanding a national law against hospital violence. IMA has declared a zero-tolerance policy against violence on doctors and health care establishments. Dr Ashok Adhao, Patron IMA Nagpur and IMA Maharashtra, Dr Kush Jhunjhunwala President and Dr Manjusha Giri Hon. Secretary IMA Nagpur have appealed all allopathic doctors to keep their non essential services closed for 24 hours from Monday 6am. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Singers regale music lovers at \u2018Kar.description: Nagpur: ‘Karva Suron Ka’, a programme of music organized by Cloud 9 Entertainment and 7 Notes Vocal Training Institute, had the audience in thrall as singers presented quality numbers at Dhanwate Sabhagruh on Saturday. The event started with a dance and singing group performance on the song ‘Albela sajan aayo re’, presented by Shyam Bapte, Nitesh Chare, Akanksha Chaudhary, Sampada Borkar, Pranjal Loya, Pooja Tol, Samvedana Ahre and Ujwal Kapde. The event had many famous songs like ‘Madhuban mein Radhika nache re’ by Shyam Bapte, ‘Chalte chalte mere yeh geet yaad rakhna’ by Adarsh Shrivastava and ‘Pal pal dil ke paas tum rehti ho’ by Milind Kulkarni which entertained music lovers. Evergreen songs like ‘Yeh mera prem patra padhkar’ by Dhananjay, ‘Kahi dur jab din dhal jaye’ by Mohan, ‘Pukarta chala hu main’ by Shridhar Mude, ‘Dum dum diga diga mausam bheega bheega’ by Sanjay Pularwar, ‘Surmai akhiyon mai’ by Prassana Nair, ‘Aye mere dil kahi aur chal’ by Shekhar Nimkhedkar, ‘Ek pyaar ka nagma hai’ by Sejal, ‘Kisi ki muskurahato pe ho nisaar’ by Dhananjay, ‘Lakho hai nigah main’ by Shridhar Mude, ‘Bulleya’ by Ujwal Kapde, ‘pal pal dil ke pass tum rehti ho’ by Milind. Videos of songs playing in the background was an added attraction. Singers from all age groups, from small children to elders, regaled the spectators with impressive presentation of hit songs. Earlier, chief guests Vishnu Manohar, Rakesh Samarth, Vijay Jate and Nandu Andhare lit the traditional lamp to mark the inauguration of the programme. Mukul Pande, who organized the event, has been in music industry for the last 15 years and has performed in cities like Pune, Mumbai, Kolkata, Hyderabad and Nagpur. 7 Notes Vocal Training Institute, established a year back, has 28 students. The main focus of the institute is to teach students proper ‘swar, taal and lay’. Experts the also teach how to use different instruments as well. Attention is paid that students of music learn from mistakes so that they could perform well during the programme. Anchor of the show shared many interesting facts, especially about songs based on classical music. The anchor said classical music is the pride of Indian culture which takes years to master the craft. Giving examples, the anchor said classical music should be taught since early age under the guidance of a guru. A short film on the raining institute was screened in which various vocal techniques were showed. Glimpses of the events organized earlier were also shown. Some of the singers shared their learning experience at the institute. Quotes The singers had done homework well and presented songs beautifully. The organizers of the show also did a wonderful job Satish Bais | businessman The selection of songs was good. Celebrated song ‘Ajeeb dastan hai yeh’ from movie ‘Dil Apna Aur Preet Paria’ was presented very nicely Divya Shrivastav | accountant Though singers sang beautifully, I liked the way the little kids were singing and their expressions were impressive Naresh Gacchakayala | government employee (Reporting by Pushkar Singh and Prajyot Deoghare) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Nagpur: MD drug kingpin nabbed.description: NAGPUR: With the arrest of two drug peddlers, the anti-narcotics cell of the city crime branch have busted a major drug racket. The accused have been identified as Mujahid Ahmed Ashraf, the alleged kingpin, and Imran Dalla. Police nabbed the duo and seized 55 grams of Mephedrone commonly known as ‘MD’ in the wee hours of Friday at Gittikhadan. Besides the drugs, police have also a car, in all worth Rs9.65 lakh. The cops had received a tip-off about two men, having a huge consignment of MD drug, waiting in a car at Gittikhadan for delivery. Police raided the spot and nabbed the accused. It is learnt that since the mastermind of the racket Feroze Khan alias Abu was nabbed and sent to jail, Mujahid had taken over the business. However, he was selling the drug to consumers by ditching the middle men due to which the cops were having a hard time nabbing him. The anti-narcotics cell, under the guidance of PI RD Nikam, nabbed them. It is learnt that Mujahid had been selling the drug to several high-profile clients. The duo has been booked under sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NMC to demolish 121 illegal religious st.description: Nagpur: The Nagpur Bench of Bombay High Court on Monday was informed by the civic authorities that 121 illegal religious structures within city limits will be demolished within one month. The bench comprising justices RK Deshpande and Vinay Joshi directed Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) commissioner to later file an affidavit stating that all 121 structures have been demolished. NMC will give 15-day notice to the parties affected, before the actual demolition takes place. Last year, the NMC took a count of total illegal religious structures within its jurisdiction and then segregated them into category A and B. Those in category B were the ones which could not be regularized and had to be demolished. A special committee heard objections and claims over the list and finally 1,084 structures were put in category A while 121 were put in category B. Advocate Firdos Mirza appeared for the petitioners while advocate Sudhir Puranik represented NMC. On September 19 last year, the HC had directed NMC to form a committee under the civic chief to prepare a revised list of illegal religious structures within city limits. It directed that structures that can be regularized should be included in category A, while those which cannot be regularized should be put in category B. \nTheatre connoisseurs enjoy the thrills.description: Enid Blyton’s classic English story— Five on a Treasure Island — from the famous five series was recently staged as a play in the city and it received great response from the theatre lovers. The play was directed by Vikash Khurana and had many thrilling and adventurous moments coupled with timely humour to keep the audience’s interest levels intact till the end. The young actors delighted the discerning audience with their performances and Khurana’s role as an antagonist was also appreciated by everyone. When we asked the director whether he had any inhibitions prior to the staging of the play, he said, “My biggest concern was to incorporate various scenes from the play on a small stage, but with proper planning, we managed to transcend the audience to Kirrin Island and the English countryside where the story is set.” We saw educationist Dr Dipti Christian and theatre person Aditya Bansod enjoying the theatrical treat with their friends.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Govt fleecing farmers on crop insurance:.description: Nagpur: Former minister and Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Anil Deshmukh has accused the BJP-led state government of “looting” farmers in the name of providing crop insurance. In a press release issued on Monday, Deshmukh pointed out that crop insurance premiums are deducted from agriculture loans provided to farmers leaving the latter with no options but to pay up. “There was a severe drought last year. Farmers, including orange and sweet lime (Mausambi) orchard owners, lost their crop totally. But not one of them received any claim from the insurance companies. Yet, all nationalized banks have yet again been instructed to deduct crop insurance premium amounts from crop loan being disbursed to farmers,” he said. “So, who is benefiting from crop insurance plans?” asked Deshmukh . He alleged that private insurance companies who have mandate to run crop insurance schemes were the ones whose interests the government was protecting. “Citrus fruit orchards’ insurance claims and that of other kharif crops are handed by different private companies who fail to respond to claims filed by hapless farmers,” Deshmukh said. The NCP leader has represented the orange belt of Katol-Narkhed area since 1995 in the state legislature before he was defeated in 2014 by nephew Ashish Deshmukh, who contested against him riding on the Modi wave. “The government has not given a penny to farmers reeling under drought and crop losses. Farm loan waiver scheme of the BJP government is yet to reach even 20% of the beneficiaries because of slow roll out,” said Deshmukh, preparing pitch for state elections that are just three months away. Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Civic body allows Essel to take city\u20.description: Nagpur: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has given permission to private operator Nagpur Solid Waste Processing and Management Private Ltd (NSWPMPL) for using city’s garbage in its Waste to Energy Plant situated in Jabalpur. The move is likely to create a controversy at the civic body. In its June 12 issue, TOI had reported that NSWPMPL, a company incorporated by the Noida-based Essel Infraprojects Limited and Japan-based Hitachi Zosan India Private Ltd brought a garbage segregation machine instead of installing the Waste to Energy Plant at the Bhandewadi dumping yard raising doubts whether the company will develop the city’s project or not. Project director of Essel Infraprojects Jeewan Sonwane had told TOI about the plan to transport the city’s garbage to the Jabalpur plant as the latter was not getting the required quantum of garbage over there. Mayor Nanda Jichkar and East Nagpur MLA Krishna Khopde dedicated the garbage segregation machine to the public on Sunday. NMC additional municipal commissioner Ram Joshi confirmed to TOI about the permission given to the operator for using the city’s garbage in the Jabalpur plant. “The operator has been given 10 acres of land for the project. Garbage was lying on this land and needed to be shifted. The operator had shifted garbage from some area. Now, the process to shift garbage from the remaining area is under way. Permission is in the contract itself to shift garbage lying on the project’s land. The operator cannot take the day-to-day garbage to Jabalpur and to establish the plant,” he said. As per the agreement, the NMC will pay Rs 70 crore to the operator for developing the project, pay tipping charges for treating 800 tonnes of garbage per day, producing 11.5MW power and disposing waste content by developing the landfill site. The move will create a controversy if the operator is paid everything for taking garbage to Jabalpur and not developing all systems here. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors\u2019 strike total, only emergen.description: NAGPUR: A 24-hour complete shutdown was observed by private hospitals, clinics and nursing homes from 6am on Monday to demand a central law to protect doctors from violence by patients’ relatives. In line with a nationwide strike called by Indian Medical Association (IMA), most doctors kept Outdoor Patient Departments (OPDs) of their hospitals closed for the day. Only emergency services and casualty wards were functioning. Diagnostic services and pathologies were also closed for the day. Doctors practicing ayurveda, homeopathy and other schools of medicines also kept their clinics closed to express solidarity with their counterparts practicing allopathy. While private doctors observed the strike, residents as well as senior doctors at Government Medical Colleges across the region worked with black ribbons on their hands. Nagpur, being a medical hub in Central India, receives patients from nearby areas of Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. Many patients coming from the rural parts of these states had to spend the day waiting in hospitals due to the strike. Emergency cases were given due attention and admitted to CCUs. “Six emergency cases were admitted in Critical Care Unit (CCU) on Monday. Our intentions were clear that patients should not suffer due to our agitation. Patients who came for routine check-ups were given alternative appointments promptly,” said Dr Anoop Marar, director of Orange City Hospital and Research Center. Paediatrician Dr Uday Bodhankar said that cases coming from faraway places were treated. “People from other states come with serious cases to Nagpur. Moreover, paediatric cases are vulnerable and we cannot avoid them. So, several cases were treated, and many patients were admitted,” he said. Nagpur IMA president Dr Kush Jhunjhunwala said doctors registered protest peacefully without creating problems for patients. “The one-day strike was peaceful. We made patients aware about the tough situation doctors face when patients’ relatives take law in their hands. Services will resume from Tuesday morning, and patients earlier scheduled for check-ups on Monday will be given priority,” he said. Meanwhile, members of IMA gathered at the IMA Hall on Monday morning, raised slogans and highlighted placards against the West Bengal government. “Doctors usually do not stretch the agitations so long. We are there to serve the people. But the attitude of the state’s chief minister was very disappointing. So, we had to take a stand nationwide,” said Dr Sanjay Deshpande. Even as OPDs were shut, doctors kept hospitals and waiting areas open for patients. Hospital staff told them about the strike and arranged for alternate appointments. On Monday evening, resident doctors in West Bengal called off their strike as their negotiations with the state government were successful. IMA central committee will issue directives about the future course of action to local units on Tuesday. In Yavatmal, doctors took out a silent march. “Leaders of various organizations strongly condemned the barbaric attacks on doctors on duty,” said Dr Anoop Kothari, president of IMA’s Yavatmal unit. The strike received support from social organizations like Junior Chamber, Rotary Club, Chamber of Commerce, Druggists Association, Maheshwari Samaj, Agrawal Samaj, Bar Association, Arogya Bharati, Banjara Sangh, and several others. In Chandrapur, doctors attached to IMA Chandrapur chapter kept all non-essential medical services, including OPDs, closed. IMA national working committee member Dr Mangesh Gulwade declared zero-tolerance policy against violence against doctors. A delegation of doctors met resident deputy collector Ghansham Bhugaonkar and submitted a memorandum. The World Medical Association has also passed a resolution against violence at health care establishments and urged stronger legislation against the menace. Jolt to NMC: Scania shifts green buses.description: Nagpur: Swedish bus maker Scania Commercial Vehicles India Pvt Ltd has reportedly moved out 24 of 25 ethanol-run buses from the city, burying the Nagpur Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) plan to resume country’s first green city bus service. Scania has also gone in for arbitration in its dispute with the civic body regarding termination of service. After discontinuing the service on August 13, 2018, Scania has kept its 25 buses at a yard in Hingna MIDC. TOI learnt Scania was shifting buses to another place a couple of days ago. When NMC officials checked, they found only one bus at the yard. “Scania should have informed NMC before shifting the buses. We will once again check the agreement and take necessary steps,” the officials said. NMC sources said Scania might have shifted the buses either to Hyderabad or Bengaluru. “Scania may also shift the remaining one bus out of city or keep it here for demonstration,” sources said. City MP and Union minister for road transport and highways Nitin Gadkari had held a series of meetings with Scania officials to resume the service. It was his pet project. NMC had launched the project as it was suggested by Gadkari. However, Scania refused to resume the service. NMC then planned to restart it by roping in a new operator. Plan was that the new operator will buy buses from Scania. Sources added talks between NMC and Scania failed as the latter refused to sell buses at depreciated value. “Pune-based Travel Time Car Rental Pvt Ltd, one of NMC’s red bus operators, had agreed to buy the buses and restart service. Plan could have materialized if Scania had agreed to sell buses at depreciated value,” the sources said. In an another shocker for NMC, Scania has gone in for arbitration. Before discontinuing the service, Scania had filed a petition in the district court and succeeded in getting an order to restrict NMC from forfeiting its bank guarantee of Rs 7.50 crore. NMC then began efforts for a settlement. Scania had demanded payment with GST which the NMC refused. Therefore, NMC did not pay anything to Scania from July 1, 2017, till termination. NMC was confident of resolving payment issues with Scania as well as resume the service. NMC officials said counsel AR Patil has been appointed arbitrator to resolve issues. “Scania filed a petition in High Court seeking arbitrator. HC ordered appointment of arbitrator on April 26,” the officials said. Scania did not respond to TOI’s mail seeking comments. Former mayor and corporator Pravin Datke said appropriate action will be taken against Scania as well as the officials of NMC’s city transport department. “NMC has bank guarantee of Rs 7.50 crore and payment of Rs 11 crore. We will check legal provisions and take action againt Scania.” “It is very unfortunate that Scania did not even give any intimation to us. The officials are also equally responsible for this. In fact, the negligence of officials resulted into discontinuation of the project. I will request the civic chief to initiate action against responsible officials immediately,” he said. Scania has parked three ethanol-run buses at its yard situated out of the city at Gondkhairi. These buses were not part of Green Bus service. Scania might also shift these buses to Bengaluru in coming days. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Goon let off by IPS officer in Jan 2018.description: NAGPUR: Swapnil Salunkhe was arrested from Kamal Chowk on June 13 in connection with an assault on cops on December 26, 2017. Ironically, he had earlier been allegedly allowed to walk away from custody in the same case, on the intervention of an IPS officer in January 2018. He was sent to magisterial custody on June 15 by the court. Salunkhe, earlier an accused in a murder where Maharashtra Control of Organized Crime Act (MCOCA) was invoked, is learnt to be a close associate of dreaded Ippa gang. He had been booked in a case of assault on cops in an incident of December 26 in 2017. The offence against Salunkhe and 10 others, including gangster Ippa’s brothers Naushad and Irshad, was registered at Pachpaoli police station. On December 26, 2017, cops had gone to arrest members of the Ippa gang near the railway tracks adjoining Nova Company at Motibagh in connection with a case of attempt to murder registered at Tehsil police station for attacking a rival the previous day. The gangsters had managed to flee after showering bricks on crime branch cops and also damaging their vehicle. MCOCA was invoked against the Ippa gang in the offence registered at Tehsil police station but questionable intervention of senior officers led to removal of a goon’s name from the charge sheet. The goon’s kin is allegedly close to a senior politician from city. Salunkhe was rounded up by crime branch’s unit number three and taken to their Lakdapool police chowky in January last year. Unconfirmed sources claimed that while recording his statement crime branch officials received a call from a top police officer. After this Salunkhe was been let off. A senior IPS officer had told TOI that Salunkhe was not present at the site as per his cell phone location and other evidence, which prompted the decision to let him go from custody. After that, police have till date been unable to trace the Ippa brothers Naushad and Irshad. Salunkhe too had been let off. With crucial arrests pending, the charge sheet could not be sent in the case. Sub-inspector Anant Wadatkar of Pachpaoli police station said the charge sheet would be sent soon now. “There was adequate evidence against Salunkhe for police to arrest him. There were statements of witnesses and other details which justified his arrest,” said Wadatkar. “Salunkhe also had cases of murder and three to four other offences against him,” he said. Wadatkar, skirting controversies, said Salunkhe had managed to flee from Lakdapool and no one had let him go. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman cop\u2019s parting gift: Rs51,000.description: Nagpur: Police naik constable Hemlata Khadgi (Gokhe), 48, who opted for voluntary retirement with 11 years still to go, gave her colleagues at Jaripatka police station a rest room as a parting gift. She contributed Rs51,000 from the benefits she got from the department to ensure a room was erected for women colleagues. A rest room for women cops at the police station struck Hemlata as one of the biggest requirements, to ensure they have a place for a breather in between strenuous working schedule at odd hours. Hemlata had worked the night shift continuously for five years, to ensure her only son Dhruv’s upbringing was not affected, as her husband Deepak worked at a central government office in regular office hours. In fact, it was Deepak’s transfer to Gujarat that prompted Hemlata to quit and follow him there. “I worked in the night and looked after my son in the day time when my husband was at office. One of us had to sacrifice for our son’s sake. We could compromise on everything but not on the son’s upbringing,” she said. “At times, I used to look around the police station in the wee hours of the day, trying to find a corner to just lay down for a while out of exhaustion,” she said, “Sometimes even a woman complainant would land up at odd hours with children in tow, and have nowhere to go.” “I hope my contribution will help my women colleagues rest and also change in case they get drenched in rain or something,” she said. Hemlata’s send-off also had a different hue as it was held, upon her insistence, at the Government Observation Home for children at Patankar Chowk on June 14, and not at the police station as usual. Hemlata’s gifted clothes to the underprivileged inmates, and complete sets of books and stationary to two students of standards X and IX. Hemlata’s decision lit up the lives of the inmates of the government home for one day, as Jaripatka police too turned it into an ‘Eid milan’, distributing ‘Sheer kurma’ to all. Hemlata, who joined the police department 21 years and six months ago, has always celebrated special moments at places like old age homes and orphanages, whether birthdays or anniversaries. “It brings special happiness if shared with people who need love and care more than others,” said Hemlata. Helping children too is nothing new too for Hemlata, something she had been doing as a cop too. “I had taken several abandoned and unattended children to safe shelters. Once I rushed a newly-born baby to orphanage after spotting him at a dumping site at Mominpura. The baby survived, and I still have his picture in my mobile phone, and keep seeing it from time to time,” said the woman cop, who now intends to be a housewife at least for the foreseeable future. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NNTR drivers may get aid for new vehicle.description: NAGPUR: Looking at the pathetic condition of safari vehicles at Navegaon-Nagzira Tiger Reserve (NNTR), officials are aggressively working on a plan to help local drivers get financial assistance for purchase of new four wheelers. On Tuesday itself a gypsy broke down during the evening safari, forcing a tourist to walk 4km inside the core jungle. Forest officials are exploring options of negotiating a good deal with banks or getting funds through some government scheme. Poonam Pate, NNTR deputy director (core) said, “We are trying to see if a discounted rate of interest can be negotiated for vehicle loans. They did a similar thing in Tadoba and we are trying to work along the same route.” Another option for the forest officials is to dip into funds from some state or central government scheme. “That option is at a very preliminary stage and a bit of a remote possibility for now. But we are trying to find out if there is some kind of scheme where we can access funds for new vehicles,” said Pate. There are 43 vehicles plying in NNTR with a majority of them in bad shape. Many consider it a miracle that these vehicles don’t break down as often as they should. While pulling the plug on all these vehicles may seem the logical thing to do, forest officials say the solution isn’t practical. “This would mean taking away employment opportunities from villagers who reside here. They are not in a position to invest their own money to buy new vehicles. In fact, some of them may not even be in a position to get it financed either. These are ground realities that one needs to keep in mind before taking any decision and that is why we are exploring options to help them,” said Pate. Maintenance of vehicles to prolong their life is also out of the question at this point of time. Sources say these vehicles are literally running on ‘prayers’ and there is no scope for any kind of mechanical intervention to salvage the vehicles. Regularly review services, GMC deans tol.description: NAGPUR: Secretary of Medical Education and Drugs Department, Dr Sanjay Mukherjee, has asked deans of all government medical colleges (GMCs) in the state to regularly review situation of patients and resident doctors in every department. These instructions, given through a correspondence earlier last week, came following recent assaults on resident doctors in West Bengal. These instructions are important, especially in case of Nagpur as both the GMCs in city are overburdened with patient load. Recently, an incident of assault on doctors and a complaint about inadequate services in the delivery ward were reported at Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH). Dean of one of the GMCs in Nagpur confirmed that he has received the letter. “We have been asked to be more alert and conduct our periodical reviews without fail. Accordingly, all necessary instructions have been issued to the department heads,” he said. The letter further states that senior doctors and technicians must remain present in hospitals during their duty timings, especially in case of indoor patient treatment. It also directs seniors as well as resident doctors to improve communication with patients and avoid clashes. Deans in medical colleges in Yavatmal, Akola, and Chandrapur have also received the correspondence. More than 14 women admitted in maternity ward at Yavatmal GMC had suffered surgical infections in April this year. As these medical colleges gets plenty of patients from the peripheral areas, deans have been asked to give additional attention towards communication between residents and rural patients. \nStudents of ETC department of Yeshwant.description: It was time for the final year students of ETC department, Yeshwantrao Chavan College of Engineering, to bid goodbye to their college life. The farewell bash, which was organised recently on the college premises, was full of fun and nostalgia. Partying with their friends one last time, youngsters experienced a gamut of emotions. While outstation students were sad to leave the city, many seemed excited to join the companies they have been placed in through campus recruitment. Girls and boys didn’t forget to click numerous selfies and group snaps, which were instantly updated on their social media accounts. To add some more fun to the bash, various games were organised wherein seniors and juniors enthusiastically participated. Later, a leg-pulling session not only evoked plenty of laughter, but also proved to be a catalyst in making the bond stronger between the juniors and seniors.
